value.0: "There, everything seems to be in order. Was there something I can help you with, <sir/madam>?"
"Very good. I shall keep watch and keep house. Have a pleasant day, <sir/madam>."
"That would be entirely inappropriate and out of character for me, thank you very much! Besides, I'm not dressed for dancing. Maybe someday you could make me a nice golem body."
"It is good to have a <master/mistress> again and perhaps you can lift the melancholy from this place. You might want to consider throwing a few parties, don't you think?"

"And don't go neglecting your health, either, <sir/madam>! That outfit doesn't look proper for the season - I haven't been outside in ages, but since you have to go outside all the time, you should dress warmly."

"Oh, it's never been a truly happy home. Even before Lady Rehan passed, she would sometimes weep just as she does now. But it was never my place to console her. Only to observe, as is befitting of a butler."

"The night before she died, a man came to visit her and spent it in her bed. It was as if she took on his joy and he took her weeping sadness... But I should not gossip about my former mistress. Suffice to say it did not end well."

Comment.value: check if the suit of armor is still "alive"

value.0: "At any rate, her spirit still haunts this place as do those of all of us who served her. Be careful and do what you can for her."
"At any rate, things are much better now and m'Lady Rehan's spirit, at long last, rests in peace."
"Welcome back, <Master/Mistress>! In case you haven't noticed, I've been able to brighten things up a little around here... Oh, and Lady Rehan requested that I offer you this gift on her behalf."
"It is the hand mirror she brought with her to her death. It has the power to resurrect your friends and loved ones when they fall, so use it wisely, <Master/Mistress>."
"Oh goodness, where to begin? You showed her sister, Lady Ellysia, the truth about that philandering scoundrel, Sir Becket. What is more, you brought Ellysia back together with her true love, Feran."

"All she ever wanted was for the people she loved to be happy and you, at long last, <sir/madam>, have given them that happiness. In so doing, you have given Lady Rehan at least a taste of that same joy."

"Yes, <sir/madam>, I do believe she has. I think I even saw a smile on her face as she faded from view. But the gift, <sir/madam>, she was very insistent that you receive it as a token of her thanks."

Comment.value: if pc lied about owning the house.

value.0: "Are you certain you aren't the new owner of this home? I am willing to abide by the finders-keepers rule. All I want to do is be a good butler."

Comment.value: If Candelabra is not the butler for the PC.

value.0: A ghostly voice echoes out of the flames of the candelabra. "Good <quarterday>, <sir/madam>. Might I make an inquiry and give a piece of advice?"
"Unless you are ready to make war on ghostly spirits, you should probably leave. There are some pretty wilfull ghosts here. Just thought you might want to know."
"No problem. If you need anything in particular just speak to me again."

Comment.value: if PC has talked about this yet.

value.0: "So, are you the new <master/mistress> of the house, or are you simply... exploring?"
"Then I shall hope the best for you. Perhaps you shall be the first to enter this home and not join it in death."
"Are you just a trespasser, or are you the new owner of the manor?"

"That is unfortunate. Had I someone to butle to, I would warn them of your intrusion. As it is, I suppose I shall not bother you, <sir/madam>, though I can not promise as much from the other spirits."
"Good news, <sir/madam>! I would love to serve as your personal butler, if you can clear the other spirits out of here, that is."
"No, not really. I love being a butler. It is all I have ever known. I can be a good helper, honest I can!"
"Oh, but <sir/madam>, I can take care of the house while you are gone, tell you if anyone tries to intrude, or even warn you if someone sneaks in to assassinate you."
"Such things happen from time to time, and I would prefer to remain here with the house than go elsewhere. Please?"
"Thank you! Thank you so very much! I won't let you down, I promise. If you need anything or have any questions, just come and speak to me."
"My name was Reginald Endros, but you can just call me Lampy. That's what all the other spirits called me, and it sort of fits."
"Then... I suppose my spirit shall depart this place. I am saddened by your decision, but it is your home now."
"Very difficult to put an answer to that question. I was a butler for this manor all of my life, but when our Lady died, I found my spirit trapped in this house."

"For the longest time I was like the other, angry spirits in here, but then I discovered that I could enter objects and move about. So now I am a candelabra butler... Except that I've no one to butle for, of late."
"Before I can tell you that, there is some information I must know about you."
"My apologies, I am Reginald Endros, the butler for Lady Rehan's estate."
"That will be all."
"Dance with me, Lampy!"
"Are you happy?"
"What is the history of this place?"
"Let's see this gift of hers..."
"What have I done to deserve a gift?"
"Has Lady Rehan left us?"
"You have some advice?"
"Thanks for the advice."
"What did you want to know?"
"I do not fear them."

LinkComment.value: if PC has talked about this yet.

value.0: "What do you want to know?"
"I just happened to break in here."
"I am the <master/mistress> of this house."
"I own the house."
"I would love to have a butler."
"Wouldn't your spirit like to be free?"
"I don't need a butler."
"Alright."
"What is your name?"
"No."
"What are you?"
"What happened here?"
"You could be my butler."
"Who are you?"
